title: Smoked Trout Crostini with Grilled Fennel and Red Onion
summary: You can never have too many hor d'oeuvre recipes, so give Smoked Trout Crostini with Grilled Fennel and Red Onion a try. For $1.12 per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 10. Watching your figure? This dairy free and pescatarian recipe has 196 calories, 8g of protein, and 17g of fat per serving. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. If you have wedges onion, wedges fennel bulb, trout fillets, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. It is a rather inexpensive recipe for fans of Mediterranean food. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 63%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Smoked Trout Crostini, Christmas Crostini with Smoked Trout, and Smoked Trout and Basil Pesto Cream Cheese Crostini.

winePairing.pairingText: Italian works really well with Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. One wine you could try is Rodano Vigna Viacosta Chianti Classico. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 30 dollars.

productMatches.title: Rodano Vigna Viacosta Chianti Classico
productMatches.description: Deep concentration of Sangiovese flavors of classic cherry, earth and a hint of smoky pistachio nuts. Made with 100% Sangiovese.

instructions: Preparation                                                        On separate baking sheets, arrange breadand vegetables; brush both sides with oiland sprinkle with salt and pepper.                                                                Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat)or preheat broiler. Grill or broil bread untilcrisp, about 2 minutes per side if grilled,and 1 to 2 minutes per side if broiled. Grillor broil vegetables until golden and justtender, about 4 minutes per side if grilled,and 3 to 4 minutes per side if broiled.DO AHEAD:  Can be made 2 hours ahead. Letstand at room temperature.                                                                Arrange bread, vegetables, and trouton large platter. Garnish with fennel fronds.Serve, allowing guests to assemble crostini.                                                                            * Available at some supermarkets and atspecialty foods stores and delicatessens.                                                                         Per serving: 199.2 kcal calories,33.2 % calories from fat,   7.4 fat,1.3 saturated fat,54.3 cholesterol,19.0 carbohydrates,2.6 dietary fiber,2.0 total sugars,16.3 net carbohydrates,13.8 g protein                            Nutritional analysis provided by                                        Bon Appétit

steps.step: On separate baking sheets, arrange breadand vegetables; brush both sides with oiland sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat)or preheat broiler. Grill or broil bread untilcrisp, about 2 minutes per side if grilled,and 1 to 2 minutes per side if broiled. Grillor broil vegetables until golden and justtender, about 4 minutes per side if grilled,and 3 to 4 minutes per side if broiled.DO AHEAD:  Can be made 2 hours ahead.
Arrange bread, vegetables, and trouton large platter.
Serve, allowing guests to assemble crostini.
* Available at some supermarkets and atspecialty foods stores and delicatessens.
